description: dbKoda is built completely in JavaScript. dbKoda is licensed under the AGPL 3.0. dbKoda has a rich editing environment which fully supports MongoDB code and all MongoDB shell features. Code folding, syntax highlighting, code completion and formatting support. Quick access to explain output and an integrated shell command line. A visual aggregation builder allows rapid and accurate coding of complex aggregation pipelines. Explore your database's storage, users and collections in the dbKoda tree. See attributes and index structure. Right click access to MongoDB commands. See the MongoDB commands generated on the fly as you fill in the command input form. Connect to all your servers and switch between them on the fly as needed. Display the topology of sharded clusters and replica sets. Use SSH tunnelling to securely connect to your MongoDB production servers.
summary: dbKoda is a modern open source database development tool for MongoDB.
author: Guy Harrison,  Michael Harrison,  Chris Trott,  Guan Gui,  Wahaj Shamim,  Joey Zhao,  Kalid Hosni
